author: mrabino1
content: pls correct me where i am wrong... today there is an input throttle of 900 new validators per day. any more and a queue is formed. What is the proposed exit throttle per day before a queue is formed. Is it further quantified to if there was slashing conduct? thx

author: pietjepuk
content: Exit queue logic is the same as entry queue (i.e. `get_validator_churn_limit` in the specs). Slashing is no different, validator gets put in the queue. See also https://github.com/ethereum/annotated-spec/blob/master/phase0/beacon-chain.md#aside-note-on-a-validators-life-cycle

author: mrabino1
content: with the above throttled entry and exit, an investor can know with certainty the +/- yield (eth denominated of course and subject to uptime etc)

content: See e.g. https://ethresear.ch/t/simple-transfers-of-excess-balance/8263 , and this server for discussions on "excess withdrawal". I would expect it's not highest on the priority list though.
